attributes.action: Remove Angola from the red list
attributes.additional_details: Despite the difficulties found on the Angolan health system and the issues evolving the acquisition of the vaccine they have managed to provide vaccine to 2% of the population for the first and second doses and it is working to ensure the vaccination process is conducted with no delays, due to the above and the relationship Angola has with the United Kingdom as many Angolan students also enrol in universities in the UK we would like to know if it would be possible to review the travel ban.
attributes.background: We would like Angola to be taken off the red list. Based on the statistics Angola has presented less cases than many others European countries as well as the number of death by COVID-19.

other_parliamentary_business.body:
On 14 December, the Government announced that all 11 countries which had been on the 'red list' would be removed as of 4am, Wednesday 15 December. The Secretary of State for Health and Social Care, Sajid Javid MP also confirmed that temporary testing measures for international travel will be retained. 
MPs discussed these changes as part of a debate on a range of changes to covid-19 restrictions. 
Read the Government's announcement of these changes: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/11-countries-removed-from-the-uks-red-list 
Read updated guidance for travel to England: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/travel-to-england-from-another-country-during-coronavirus-covid-19  
Read what was said during the debate: https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2021-12-14/debates/8034393B-C568-4DE6-8695-1D63F957537E/PublicHealth
other_parliamentary_business.subject: MPs debate changes to travel restrictions for red list countries
